turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about PGA Tour 96.
turn.2: PGA Tour 96 PGA Tour 96 is a sports video game developed by Hitmen Productions for the PlayStation version, Unexpected Development for the Game Boy version, NuFX for the Sega Genesis and 3DO versions, Ceris Software for the Game Gear version and Polygames for the SNES version and published by EA Sports for PlayStation, Game Boy, Sega Genesis, 3DO, Game Gear and SNES.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It has fewer courses and golfers than previous installments.
turn.5: Can you tell me the courses it has?
turn.6: The game features 10 professional golfers as playable or as CPU opponents: Brad Faxon, Lee Janzen, Tom Kite, Bruce Lietzke, Davis Love III, Mark O’Meara, Peter Jacobsen, Jeff Sluman, Craig Stadler, and Fuzzy Zoeller.
turn.7: What are some of the courses?
turn.8: The featured courses are Spyglass Hill, TPC at Sawgrass, TPC at River Highlands.
turn.9: What other modes does the game have?
turn.10: The game has four modes: stroke play, match play, tournament mode, and practice mode.
turn.11: In what mode does the caddy decide what clubs to use?
turn.12: Golf clubs are assigned automatically by the caddy as the computer deems suitable for every lie and every situation.
